subject: RE: [junit] Problem with junit TestSetup decorator and  ant/batchtest/junitreporter
msgSnippet: oops!  yeah, that was just a type-o.  Thanks for pointing that out. ... From: Mike Clark [mailto:mike@clarkware.com] Sent: Wednesday, May 08, 2002 5:59 PM To:
messageBody:
oops! yeah, that was just a type-o. Thanks for pointing that out.
-----Original Message-----
From: Mike Clark [mailto:mike@...]
Sent: Wednesday, May 08, 2002 5:59 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Problem with junit TestSetup decorator and
ant/batchtest/junitreporter


Christian Cabanero wrote:

> I've discovered a weird bug/problem when combining junit and using a
> TestSetup decorator with ant and a batchtest task within a junit task
and
> then using a junitreport task to convert the test results into an html
> formatted report. Say you have the following TestCase:
>
> public class SomeTest extends TestCase {
>
> ....
>
> public static Test suite() {
> Test suite = new TestSuite();
> suite.addTestSuite(SomeTest.class);
>
> TestSetup setup = new TestSetup(suite) {
> protected void setup() throws Exception {
> <code that throws an exception >
> }
> protected void tearDown() throws Exception {
> ...
> }
> }
> return setup;
> }
>
> ...
> }
>

This may be unrelated, or just a typo, but make sure to replace "setup"
with
"setUp".

--
Mike Clark
Clarkware Consulting, Inc.
